Name: LocARNA web server
Function description: LocARNA simultaneously folds and aligns input sequences. Specifications of additional constraints or fixed input structures are possible.
Output Description: Alignment annotated with RNAalifold consensus structure | Guide Tree and Sub Alignments | Reliability profile (when used with Locarna-P) | RNAalifold consensus structure
Output Format: ClustalW format, FASTA, EPS, PNG, PDF | NEWICK, SVG | PDF, PNG, EPS

Name: INFORNA web server
Description: RNA sequence design by inverse folding
Function description: Design of RNA sequences that fold into a given pseudo-knot free RNA secondary structure, handling small pseudo-knots.
Output Description: Designed sequence with its MFE structure

Name: IntaRNA web server
Function description: Prediction of interactions between two RNA molecules. Predicts target sites on mRNA for given non-coding RNAs (ncRNAs) like eukaryotic microRNAs (miRNAs) or bacterial small RNAs (sRNAs), but it can also be used to predict other types of RNA-RNA interactions
Output Description: Potential targets with p-value | Functional Enrichments | Target RNA regions plot | Query RNA regions plot | Functional annotation plot
Output Type: Feature Table | Feature Table | Image | Image | Feature Table
Output Format: Textual format | Textual format | PNG, PDF, EPS | PNG, PDF, EPS | HTML, PDF

Name: MARNA web server
Function description: MARNA is a multiple alignment of RNAs taking into consideration both the primary sequence and the secondary structure. It is based on pairwise comparisons using costs of edit operations.

Name: CRISPRmap web server
Description: Prediction of CRISPR RNA by repeat conservation
Function description: CRISPRmap enables comprehensive independent clustering analyses to determine conserved sequence families, potential structure motifs for endoribonucleases, and evolutionary relationships.
Output Description: CRISPRmap tree of consensus CRISPR sequences | Class assignments | Detailed structure motifs | Detailed sequence motifs |
Output Format: NEWICK | PNG, JPG, PDF, Textual format, EPS, SVG

Name: AntaRNA web server
Description: Multi-objective sequence design by inverse folding
Function description: Design of RNA sequences into a function-specific target structure by solvong the inverse folding problem.

Name: CopraRNA web server
Description: sRNA target prediction boosted by comparative information
Output Description: Potential targets with p-value | Functional Enrichments | Target RNA regions plot | Query RNA regions plot | Functional annotation plot
Output Type: Feature Table | Feature Table | Image | Image | Feature Table | Phylogenetic tree
Output Format: Textual format | Textual format | PNG, PDF, EPS | PNG, PDF, EPS | HTML, PDF | NEWICK, SVG

Name: ExpaRNA web server
Function description: Computes arrangement of exact matching sequence-structure motives common to two RNAs
Output Description: Plot of secondary structure motifs common to both sequences

Name: CARNA web server
Description: Global structure ensemble based multiple alignment generation
Function description: CARNA requires only the RNA sequences as input and will compute base pair probability matrices and align the sequences based on their full ensembles of structures.
Output Description: Conservation Dot Plots | Alignment annotated with pseudoknot-free consensus structure
Output Format: PNG, PDF, EPS | ClustalW format | NEWICK | FASTA

Name: SECISDesign web server
Output Description: mRNA Sequence with Structure and its Probability for the SECIS-Element region after UGA stop codon

Name: ExpaRNA-P
Description: Simultaneous Exact Pattern Matching and Folding of RNAs
Function description: ExpaRNA is a fast, motif-based comparison and alignment tool for RNA molecules. It computes the best arrangement of local sequence-structure (substructure) motifs common to two RNAs.
Output Description: Alignment ad graphical representation of shared substructures between input sequences.

Name: SPARSE
Description: Very efficient structure-based alignment of RNAs
Function description: A simultaneous alignment and folding tool with quadratic complexity
Output Description: Alignment annotated with RNAalifold consensus structure | Guide Tree and Sub Alignments | Reliability profile (when used with Locarna-P) | RNAalifold consensus structure
Output Format: ClustalW format, FASTA, PDF | NEWICK | EPS

Name: LocARNA
Function description: LocARNA simultaneously folds and aligns input sequences. Specifications of additional constraints or fixed input structures are possible.
Output Description: Alignment annotated with RNAalifold consensus structure | Guide Tree and Sub Alignments | Reliability profile (when used with Locarna-P) | RNAalifold consensus structure
Output Format: ClustalW format, FASTA, PDF | NEWICK | EPS

Output Description: Plot of secondary structure motifs common to both sequences

Name: BlockClust
Description: Detect transcripts with similar processing patterns
Function description: Generate overview plots of proposed clusters
Essential input: Annotated Read Clusters | Intervals | Pairwise Similarities
Output Description: Plot of distribution of ncRNA families per predicted cluster (overview of cluster precissions)

Name: BlockClust
Description: Detect transcripts with similar processing patterns
Function description: Preprocess converts mapped reads into intervall file with tags

Name: BlockClust
Description: Detect transcripts with similar processing patterns
Function description: Clustering and Classifications is based on a graph representation of the read blocks
Essential input: Blocks of RNA reads | Nucleotide Sequence
Output Description: Hierarchical clustering plot of all input blockgroups by their similarity | Pairwise similarities of all input blockgroups | Intervals of predicted clusters | Predicted intervals of blockgroups by pre-compiled SVM binary classification model
Output Type: Image | Annotated Read Clusters | Intervals | Intervals
